definition: Streams of textual content that are automatically updated and organized for users to consume in sequence.

positive_examples: I scrolled through my Twitter timeline to see the latest posts from people I follow.
The RSS feed automatically updates with new blog articles from my favorite websites.
She checked her Instagram feed to see what her friends had been posting today.
The live blog provided continuous updates about the breaking news story.
My LinkedIn feed shows professional updates and articles from my network.
The forum's recent posts feed helps me stay current with ongoing discussions.
negative_examples: I read the entire newspaper from front to back this morning.
She wrote a detailed blog post about her vacation experiences.
The book contained fascinating stories about ancient civilizations.
He sent me a long email explaining the project requirements.
The magazine article discussed climate change in great detail.
I printed out the research paper to read it more carefully.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: StaticText, DocumentText, MessageText, ArticleText
